results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: Decisions in academic departments
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Trigger series 7. Managing people”.
Six dramatisations dealing with interpersonal aspects of staff management are designed to trigger discussion. Although set in a university the issues raised are common to all organisations.

results.title: A Toast to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Kent Chadwick, Cambridge Film Productions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Using archival film, aerial photography, stills, prints and contemporary footage, this documentary presents the city of Melbourne and its lifestyle. Looks at the unique Victorian architecture that transformed Melbourne from a tent city during the Gold Rush to a modern and prosperous city. Captures the vibrant streetscapes, the trams, the elaborate arcades and some of the institutions that cater to Melbourne’s elite such as the Georges store and the Melbourne Club. Highlights the range of sporting activities available, showing John McEnroe, Dennis Lillee and Greg Norman among others. Visits the Separation Tree in the Botanical Gardens planted to commemorate Melbourne’s independence from NSW, the bustling Queen Victoria Market, the suburbs of St Kilda and Brighton, its beaches and the Arts Precinct. Shows crowded restaurants and pubs with rock band performances that contribute to Melbourne’s nightlife. Also includes footage of areas and buildings which have disappeared or undergone major transformations since this film was produced: the docklands; the city square; Swanston Street; Foster’s Brewery; ports. The following Australian identities are also shown: Barry Humphries, Ian ‘Molly’ Meldrum, Bob Hawke, Andrew Peacock, Phillip Adams, Dick Hamer, Joan Sutherland, Jon English, Derryn Hinch, Mike Brady, Lindsay Thompson and an assortment of VFL footballers.

results.title: Are girls calculating?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This videotape can be used not only in the maths-science classroom to encourage girls to see the importance of maths, but also as a valuable resource for careers teachers, and for social science units on either the workforce or sexism in society.

results.title: Don't Think I Don't Think
results.brief_description: Documents an important conference on rights for the disabled held at Melbourne University in 1981. The disabled groups present drew up a charter of rights- rights to work, to live in their own houses etc. free of the constraints that paternalistic institutions impose

results.title: Frankston Motor Cycle Park
results.creator_credit: Robin Young and Victoria. Vandalism Task Force
results.brief_description:
Trailbike riding causes damage to the environment and violence and aggravation between riders and local residents. This video was made to give councils, police and motor-cycle clubs some starting points and pointers towards developing their own locally appropriate solution.
Made in conjunction with the Frankston Police Community Involvement Programme and Frankston TAFE.

results.title: Victoria's Energy
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description: Energy is the lifeblood of an industrial society. The program looks at Victoria’s four primary energy sources- oil, coal, gas and solar energy-and discusses their futures
